attributes.action: Immediately Order The Cessation of Lords Reform and Authorise The Handing Over of Power of Appointment (to The Upper House) to The Monarch.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
An independent Lords cannot be assured if it is drawn by election (as is proposed) as it will either leave one party with a mandate to pass any law it deems fit leading to a possible dictatorship or on the other hand if the loser in Commons elections is elected to Lords then it would be fair to assume there will be a considerable elongation of the time before a bill receives assent.
As the recent 'CASH FOR HONOURS' scandal shows the dominant commons party could be seen to be abusing its position by using the power to appoint lords as a fundraising method. Giving the monarch the power would still allow parties to suggest a possible lord through the same system as normal members of the public use and would thus make it more democratic and allow a more independent and representative house.
Also it would by maintaining current system of payments and titles (new Member of the Lords/ML title proposed) keep the costs of maintenance and the prestige of the house as is.

reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
